context_bundle.summary: Current state of AI industry December 2025: major players, model families, market dynamics, competitive landscape, and strategic implications for PhiVector development.

onboarding.quick_start: December 2025 AI landscape: Closed frontier (OpenAI GPT-5.2/o3, Anthropic Claude 4.5, Google Gemini 3 Pro, xAI Grok 4.1) vs Open frontier (DeepSeek V3.2, Meta Llama 4, Alibaba Qwen 2.5, Mistral). Key shift: open source now matching closed on benchmarks. DeepSeek proved frontier performance at 10x lower cost. All labs pivoting to agentic + reasoning models. Infrastructure costs brutal (Oracle -45%). Regulation incoming (US national framework). PhiVector positioned well for local-first as consumer hardware improves.
common_patterns: === MAJOR PLAYERS (CLOSED SOURCE) ===
OPENAI: GPT-5.2 (general), o3 (reasoning), o3-mini (fast reasoning). 800M weekly ChatGPT users. Enterprise focus. Sam Altman 'code red' on Gemini 3 threat.
ANTHROPIC: Claude Opus 4.5 (most intelligent), Sonnet 4.5 (balanced), Haiku 4.5 (fast). Enterprise + coding focus. Constitutional AI approach.
GOOGLE: Gemini 3 Pro (flagship), Gemini 3 (base). Deep integration with Search, Workspace. Claims 72% answer accuracy. Antigravity agentic coding platform.
XAI: Grok 4.1 with major reasoning/safety/emotional intelligence gains. Competitive pricing. Fast iteration cycle.
=== MAJOR PLAYERS (OPEN SOURCE) ===
DEEPSEEK: V3.2 (685B MoE, 37B active), V3.2-Speciale (reasoning variant). Chinese lab, MIT license. Matching GPT-5 on benchmarks at 10x lower cost.
META: Llama 4 (Maverick 17B-128E, Scout). Continued open-weight commitment. Commercial-friendly license with restrictions.
ALIBABA: Qwen 2.5 family. Strong multilingual. Various sizes. Permissive license. Chinese lab.
MISTRAL: European lab. Efficient small models (7B-22B). Business-friendly. NeMo, Small 3.1 variants.
=== MODEL CAPABILITY TIERS ===
TIER 1 FRONTIER: GPT-5.2, Claude Opus 4.5, Gemini 3 Pro, DeepSeek V3.2-Speciale - best overall performance
TIER 2 PRODUCTION: GPT-4o, Claude Sonnet 4.5, Gemini 3, DeepSeek V3.2, Grok 4.1 - excellent cost/performance
TIER 3 FAST: GPT-4o-mini, Claude Haiku 4.5, Gemini Flash, Llama 4 Scout - speed optimized
TIER 4 LOCAL: Llama 3.1 8B/70B, Qwen 2.5 7B/14B/72B, Mistral 7B/22B - consumer hardware viable
=== REASONING MODEL CATEGORY ===
OPENAI o3: State-of-art reasoning. Variable compute modes. ARC-AGI breakthrough but 100-600x more expensive than 4o.
DEEPSEEK R1: Built on V3 base. RLVR (Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards). Open weights.
V3.2-SPECIALE: High-compute reasoning variant. IMO/IOI 2025 gold medal performance. Extended thinking mode.
CLAUDE EXTENDED THINKING: Opus 4.5 with reasoning traces. Agentic capabilities.
=== MARKET DYNAMICS ===
SCALE: ChatGPT 800M weekly users (Dec 2025). Enterprise reasoning tokens up 320x YoY.
PRICING PRESSURE: DeepSeek at $0.27/$1.10 per M tokens vs GPT-4o at $2.50/$10. 10x cost advantage.
OPEN SOURCE MOMENTUM: DeepSeek matching closed models on benchmarks signals moat erosion.
INFRASTRUCTURE COSTS: Oracle -45% stock after $12B quarterly capex. Datacenter buildout brutal.
SUPPLY CONSTRAINTS: H100 allocation scarce. Multi-month lead times. China sanctions reshaping supply chain.
=== AGENTIC SHIFT ===
ALL LABS: Training for tool use, multi-step reasoning, environment interaction.
DEEPSEEK: 1,800+ synthetic environments, 85,000+ agentic tasks in training data.
ANTHROPIC: Claude computer use (screenshots, clicks, typing).
OPENAI: ChatGPT plugins, browsing, code interpreter, file handling.
GOOGLE: Gemini Workspace integration, agentic coding with Antigravity.
=== REGULATORY LANDSCAPE ===
US: Trump admin pushing national AI framework to preempt state regulations. 'Tech Force' initiative.
EU: AI Act in effect. Compliance burden growing. Risk-based classification.
CHINA: Domestic AI push. Huawei chip alternatives. Export controls driving innovation.
=== PHIVECTOR IMPLICATIONS ===
LOCAL FIRST: Consumer hardware (RTX 5070 Ti 16GB) can run 7B-32B models at Q4. Viable for many tasks.
OPEN SOURCE: DeepSeek, Llama, Qwen provide frontier-adjacent capabilities for free.
AGENTIC ALIGNMENT: Our multi-agent architecture (DC/KALIC) mirrors industry direction.
EFFICIENCY FOCUS: MoE and sparse attention techniques applicable to local deployments.
COST OPTIMIZATION: API pricing dropping. Mix local inference with API calls for cost optimization.
known_errors: TRAINING COSTS: $5.5M claims are final run only. Exclude R&D, failed runs, data acquisition, salaries. True cost 5-20x higher.
BENCHMARKS: Gaming is real. Models optimize for benchmarks, real-world performance varies. Test on YOUR tasks.
OPEN vs CLOSED: 'Catching up' on benchmarks doesn't mean parity on all tasks. Closed models often better at edge cases.
DISTILLATION: Some open models may have trained on closed model outputs. Legal and ethical grey area.
CAPABILITY CLAIMS: Marketing hype is real. 'Human-level' claims are misleading. Test empirically.
PRICING: API prices change frequently. These figures are Dec 2025 snapshots. Verify before planning.
REGULATORY: Landscape evolving rapidly. EU AI Act, US executive orders, state laws all in flux.
CHINA MODELS: Export compliance, data provenance, and geopolitical considerations apply.
